laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: CT Abdomen & Pelvis with & without Contrast

findings.Lower Chest: Small left pleural effusion with adjacent compressive atelectasis, enlarged heart.

Abdomen.Hepatobiliary: Liver demonstrates homogenous attenuation, no evidence of focal lesions.
Abdomen.Pancreas: 9.3 x 7 x 10 cm multiloculated cystic mass in the head of the pancreas, stable in size.
Abdomen.Urinary: 5 mm nonobstructing stone in the lower pole of the right kidney.
Abdomen.Gastrointestinal: Unremarkable stomach, normal small bowel, colon and rectum.
Abdomen.Pelvis: Unremarkable urinary bladder and distal ureters.
Abdomen.Vascular: No abdominal aortic aneurysm, moderate atherosclerotic disease.
Abdomen.Bones: No evidence of worrisome osseous lesions, severe disc space narrowing at L5-S1.

changes_over_time.pancreas: Dilatation of the main pancreatic duct and atrophy of the remaining pancreatic parenchyma, similar to prior.
